author: potuz
content: earlier than 2 slots in advance I think it's completely impossible (as a slashing can happen this slot and be included in the next one). One slot in advance is probably theoretically possible (assuming you trust that if there was any previous slashing you would have seen it) but it's tough to say for sure.

author: ajsutton
content:
The proposers are fixed for the entire current epoch. So you can calculate them all once you have the last block of the prior epoch. 
If a scheduled proposer is slashed they are still scheduled to propose but the block will be rejected resulting in an empty slot.

author: potuz
content: Yeah I think this all clients do. But with the merge we're thinking on guessing the shuffle for the next epoch even before having the last block. You can accurately guess for next epoch, but a slashing in the last slot for example can change the shuffling

author: ajsutton
content:
Yep or a change in effective balance can change it though less likely. 
That said you have just as long to prepare a block at the start of an epoch as any other slot since you need to now the parent block to be able to select transactions etc anyway.
